text:
(1) and (2)

White's Pond (Staten Island): A winter scene of the pond, located on the George B. White property, north side of Arthur Kill Road, east of Richmond Avenue. View 2 shows a road in the woods, near the pond.

By William T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

December 28, 1921

folder: Arthur Kill Road & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Richmond Avenue
text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, south side, east of Richmond Avenue, showing the residence on the George W. White estate. View 2 shows the 3-story barn and sheds. The estate was at one time known
as the Green Ridge stock farm.

Spring 1924
Views 1, 2

P. L. Sperr

text:

sandsucker.

text:
Richmond Avenue, north from Arthur Kill Road, showing, on the right side of the thoroughfare, land being filled for the erection of a new bridge over Richmond Creek. The three views were taken the same day.

January 31, 1931

folder: Arthur Kill Road & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Richmond Avenue
text:
893 Arthur Kill Road, adjoining the N.W. corner of Richmond Avenue. This house is located on the estate of Emma L. Banker. The sign over the doorway reads: Concordia Collie Kennels, Puppies for Sale, Boarding.

May 17, 1932

P. L. Sperr

folder: Arthur Kill Road & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Richmond Avenue
text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, south side, between Richmond
and Wainright Avenues, showing the Bancker (Banker) House. The house is about 500 feet south of the road and is approachable by a private driveway.

May 17, 1932

P. L. Sperr

(2)
Another view of the house and the private
driveway as seen from Arthur Kill Road. The sign on
the house reads: Will Rent For Restaurant.

May 17, 1932

P. L. Sperr
